title: Concerning Christian Liberty
creator: Martin Luther
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
description: LibriVox recording of Concerning Christian Liberty by Martin Luther, translated by Robert S. Grignon. Read by Jonathan Lange. Early in the course of the Reformation (1520) Martin Luther penned a trilogy of foundational documents addressing the Church, the Nobility and the Christian life. This document concerning the Christian life expounds the famous paradox: "A Christian man is the most free lord of all, and subject to none; a Christian man is the most dutiful servant of all, and subject to every one." (Summary by Jonathan Lange) For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org. M4B format available
subject: librivox; audiobook; luther; reformation; liberty; freedom; christian; religion
